headerDisplay:
# AirPort Express Connected 

 Plugin that creates an occupancy sensor that shows wether or not there is an active AirPlay 2 connection to AirPort Express (2nd Gen.) devices. 

 This plugin is supposed to be a painless experience. There is **no configuration required**. Just install and start the plugin. Devices will be automatically discovered and sensors created. Tweaking the configuration is completely optional. 

 Made with ‚ù§ by [maxileith](https://github.com/maxileith).

name.title: Platform Name
name.description: The name of the plugin, e.g. shown in the logs.

update.title: Update
update.description: All settings that affect the detection of state changes of AirPort Express devices:

refreshRate.title: Refresh Rate (seconds)
refreshRate.description: Interval in which the current AirPlay 2 status is queried.

ignoreGroupWithLeadingDevice.title: Ignore Group with leading device.
ignoreGroupWithLeadingDevice.description: When disconnecting from an AirPlay group, the group will predestine a leading device, thus the AirPort Express is still connected to a device and will be report as connected. This ensures that the AirPort Express is reported as disconnected if it is part of a group with a leading device. This option is recommended to be checked for most users. However, in edge cases like playing music from a HomePod to the AirPort, this option will prohibit the AirPort Express from being reported as connected.

unreachable.title: Unreachable
unreachable.description: Settings regarding the behavior of the exposed accessories in case the AirPort Express is unreachable.

ignore.title: Ignore
ignore.description: Do not report that the AirPort Express is unreachable.

threshold.title: Threshold (seconds)
threshold.description: Time an AirPort Express device must be unreachable to be reported as unreachable.

reportDisconnected.title: Report as disconnected
reportDisconnected.description: If selected, the plugin will report the AirPort Express as disconnected, thus automations that are triggered on disconnect are being triggered before the device is reported as unreachable.

discovery.title: Discover
discovery.description: All settings that affect the discovery of AirPort Express devices:

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Should new device be discovered? When disabled, only already cached devices will be exposed.

always.title: Always
always.description: When enabled, new device will be discovered always. When disabled, new device will only be discovered at startup.

intervals.title: Intervals (seconds)
intervals.description: Intervals in which to search for new devices.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Only discover devices on the whitelist. This won't affect cached devices. (Can't be enabled when the blacklist is already enabled)

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Only discover devices not on the blacklist. This won't affect cached devices. (Can't be enabled when the whitelist is already enabled)

discardKnownDevices.title: Discard Known Devices
discardKnownDevices.description: Delete known devices from cache if they do not match the white- or blacklist any longer.
